purpleculture_pinyin:
tóng
pupil of the eye
зрачок глаза
rtega_mnemonic:
瞳瞳RSpupil of eye, stupid, ignorant
  • part of the eye 目 that does not change from childhood 童 on
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 童 indicates the sound; 目 (eye) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
瞳孔 [ tóng kǒng ]: pupil (of eye)
瞳仁 [ tóng rén ]: pupil of the eye
瞳眸 [ tóng móu ]: pupil of the eye; one's eyes
美瞳 [ měi tóng ]: cosmetic contact lens; big eye contact lens; circle contact lens
双瞳剪水 [ shuāng tóng jiǎn shuǐ ]: clear, bright eyes (idiom)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 目 [ mù ] eye; to look, to see; division, topic
    • 童 [ tóng ] child, boy; servant boy; virgin
heisig_keyword: pupil | ученик, to strain one's eyes, to stare
heisig_constituent: pupil, eye, juvenile, vase, stand up, computer
heisig_story: Begin with the double meaning of the key word pupil: "student" and the "the apple of one's eye." Now all you have to do is dwell on the phrase "juvenile of one's eye" (the meaning here) until it provides you with an image.
koohiiStory1: In Japanese comics, the eye´s of juvenilles all have enormouse pupils.
koohiiStory2: WARNING: This kanji only means the pupil of the eye. It can be confusing to use a story that has pupil meaning student in it.
jp_example_words: 瞳(ひとみ): eye, pupil (of eye)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Inside your eye stands a tiny village that makes up your pupil. That's the black part of your eye!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Oh, did you think your pupil was a hole? No, no, you misunderstand. That's where the village stands. It's full of little people who whisper to your brain what you should see.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: All of the people in your pupil eat doughnuts (どう) all day long. That's why your eye is shaped like a doughnut, with the "hole" (village) as their home.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Even if you're a pupil non-believer, at least you can see how it's shaped like a doughnut hole, right?
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 眸 (ひとみ、ボウ зрачок).
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the child (童) of an eye (目) is the pupil

瞳字的基本解释

瞳
tóng
〔瞳孔〕虹膜中央的小孔，光线通过瞳孔进入眼内。通称“瞳子”、“瞳人”、“瞳仁”。
懵懵懂懂，瞪着眼看的样子：“汝瞳焉如新生之犊”。

瞳字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tóng］
［《廣韻》徒紅切，平東，定。］
(1)瞳孔。眼球中央的小孔，能随着光线的强弱而缩小或扩大。
(2)借指目光。
(3)无知直视貌。
(4)看见。

瞳字的英文翻译

◎ 瞳
pupil

瞳字的康熙字典解释

【午集中】【目字部】　瞳； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页818第04
【廣韻】【正韻】徒紅切【集韻】【韻會】徒東切，?音同。【玉篇】目珠子也。【釋名】瞳子。瞳，重也，膚幕相裹重也。【靈樞經】骨之精爲瞳子。【註】腎之精也。　又通作童。【史記·項羽本紀】舜目蓋重瞳子，項羽亦重瞳子。【前漢書】作童。【神仙傳】李根兩目童子皆方。仙經云：八百歲人童子方也。　又無心直視之貌。【莊子·知北遊】女瞳焉如新生之犢。　又【集韻】丑降切，踔去聲。【莊子·知北游郭註】瞳，菟絳反。【李註】未有知貌。【正韻】又音充。

瞳字的源字形

瞳字的起名意思

：指瞳孔；引申为看见的意思。

Hitomi
Basic explanation of words
Hitomi
tóng
[Pupil] The small hole in the center of the iris through which light enters the eye. Commonly known as "Tongzi", "Tongren", and "Tongren".
He was ignorant and stared: "Your pupil is like a newborn calf."
Hitomi
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tóng］
["Guangyun" Tu Hongqi, Pingdong, Ding. ]
(1) Pupils. The small hole in the center of the eyeball can shrink or expand with the intensity of the light.
(2) By means of gaze.
(3) Ignorance looks directly at the appearance.
(4) See.

pupil

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Lunar Concentration】【Mixue Department】　 pupil; Kangxi strokes: 17; page number: page 818 04
[Guang Yun] [Zheng Yun] Red Cut [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Club] Dong cut with the same sound? [Jade articles] Eye beads also. [Release name] Hitomi. Hitomi, heavy, and heavy on the skin. [Lingshu Sutra] The essence of bone is the pupil. [Note] The essence of the kidney.　It's a child again. [Historical Records·Xiang Yu Benji] Shunmu covered heavy pupil, Xiang Yu also heavy pupil. [Pre-Han Shu] Being a child. [God's Biography] Li Gen's two-eyed boys are square. Xian Jingyun: The eight hundred-year-old boy is also Fang.　I have no intention to look directly at it. [Zhuangzi·Journey to the North] The female pupil is like a newborn calf.　[Jiyun] Ugly cut and cut, halting. [Zhuangzi·Guo's Note on Traveling to the North of Knowing] Pupil, Dodder is inverted. [Li Note] No appearance. [Zheng Yun] The sound is full again.

Source glyph
Hitomi
Name meaning
: Refers to the pupil; extended to mean seeing.
形声字。目表意,其形体像竖着的眼睛,表示瞳在目(眼晴)中;童(16ng )表声,童有幼小一义,表示瞳是目中很小的
那部分,即瞳孔。本义是瞳孔。
瞳孔,眼球中心的圆孔,光线通过瞳孔进人眼内。通称瞳
tóng
人。
~孔 ~人 ~仁 重~ 光~
瞳
瞳
---
Пиктофонетические символы.
Значение глаза, его форма похожи на вертикальный глаз, что означает, что зрачок находится в глазу (глаз ясный); ребенок (16ng) выражает звук, а ребенок имеет значение молодого, что означает, что зрачок - очень маленькая часть глаза, то есть зрачок.
Первоначальное значение - ученик.
Зрачок, круглое отверстие в центре глазного яблока, через которое свет попадает в человеческий глаз.
Обычно известный как Хитоми
люди.
~ Конг ~ Человек ~ Травма ~ Свет ~
Хитоми
Хитоми
tóng
I сущ.
зрачок

отражаться (в глазах)
Radicals: 目, 立, 里  (eye, stand, village)
Meaning Mnemonic
Inside your eye stands a tiny village that makes up your pupil. That's the black part of your eye!
Oh, did you think your pupil was a hole? No, no, you misunderstand. That's where the village stands. It's full of little people who whisper to your brain what you should see.
Reading Mnemonic
All of the people in your pupil eat doughnuts (どう) all day long. That's why your eye is shaped like a doughnut, with the "hole" (village) as their home.
Even if you're a pupil non-believer, at least you can see how it's shaped like a doughnut hole, right?
